newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Santos says Australia well flows 3mmcfd gas.
newsitem.headline: Santos says Australia well flows 3mmcfd gas.

text.p: Oil and gas group Santos Ltd said on Thursday it recorded a gas flow of three million cubic feet per day from Beeree-1, a gas exploration well in permit ATP 259P in south west Queensland.

The flow test was conducted at a depth of 2,703 metres to test the open hole section from 2,654 to 2,703 metres in the Permian Toolachee and Patchawarra Formations through a half-inch surface choke, Santos said.
Santos said Beeree-1 was the fifth well to be drilled to assess the maximum size and deliverability of the Barrolka Field complex in ATP 259P.

The drilling results suggested a possible resource of several hundred billion cubic feet of gas in the Barrolka Field complex, located near to existing infrastructure supplying major centres of gas demand in Queensland, Santos said.
Santos said it used air drilling technology which avoids damage to the formation and achieves a better gas flow rate to confirm a good gas flow from potentially low quality rock in Beeree-1.
It said Beeree-1 will be followed by two further air drilled wells with the aim of having a firm understanding of the gas in place by the end of 1997.

Santos holds 58.8625 percent of the Beeree-1 well, Exxon Corp's Delhi Petroleum Pty Ltd 23.2 percent, Boral Ltd 16.5 percent, Gulf Australian Hydrocarbons Ltd 1.2 percent and Oil Company of Australia 0.2375 percent.
Santos shares closed three cents higher at A$5.80.
